titleStmt.title: The godly maid of Leicester. Being a true relation of Elizabeth Stretton, who lying upon her death-bed, was wonderfully delivered from the temptations of Satan, worthy the noting of all that would live and die in the fear of God. Tune is, In summertime.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E.C. for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright.,

notesStmt.note: Right half sheet contains: "The second part to the same Tune."
Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
